result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessy Richard Card was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Howard W. Cameron July 16, 2014 - Amend JOC to reflect eligibility of Substance Abuse Program. 

-Concurrent to any current sentence.


-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes:
60 days for restitution request.
Restitution Approved on 7/21/2014. Joint and Several with 14CF105.
***New Restitution order was ordered on 10/7/2014.***

Payable through Probation.
DNA Sample and surcharge.
Not to use or possess firearms.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to provide DNA Sample.
-No Contact with Riverfront Inn, Kanaka Lakshmi Morusupalli or family members.
-Bars/Taverns/Liquor Stores at discretion of Probation Agent.
-Follow all programs and recommendations of Agent/DOC.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Gross, ADA:   Kevin H Gehler   DF ATTY:  John M O'Boyle   DF:  Jessy Richard Card appeared from jail.  Agent Molly O'Keefe appears from DOC.  Case called: 9:39 a.m.  PSI rec'd and reviewed by parties, minor corrections recited by Atty O'Boyle.  No corrections by ADA Gehler and requests Court adopt PSI recommendations.   Ex 1-3: O/R.  Atty O'Boyle makes sentencing statement to Court.  DF makes statement to Court. Recess: 9:54 a.m.  Case recalled: 10:12 a.m.  Court orders:  
Count 1:  S/I: 6 years WI State Prison Systems - 3 years IC, 3 years ES - Concurrent to any current sentence.
- Challenge 
- $518 Court Costs, this includes DNA Surcharge - pay through DOC.
- 60 days for restitution request.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DNA sample.
- Not to use or possess firearms.
- No contact with Riverfront Inn, Kanaka Lakshmi Morusupalli or family members.
- Bars/Taverns/Liquor Stores as discretion of probation agent.
- Follow all programs and recommendations of DOC. 

Count 2:  S/I-S:  6 years WI State Prison Systems  3 years IC, 3 years ES.  
3 years probation consecutive to any sentencing currently serving, consecutive to Count 1 and Polk County Case.  
- $518 Court Costs - pay through DOC.  gg
Filed by Agent O'keefe. Re: PSI. km
Reviewed by HWC. km

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Gross, ADA:   Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle   DF:  Jessy Richard Card appeared from jail. PLEA HEARING on 14CF104 & 12CF164.   DF pleads Guilty to Counts 1 & 2.    Crt reviews Plea Quest /Waiver of Rights and State's burden of proof w/ DF. Both ADA and Atty stipulate to facts that support the charge DF has pled to. Crt finds DF waives constitutional rights and enters plea freely, knowingly and voluntarily.  Court finds DF Guilty of Counts 1-2 of information in 14CF104 - PSI ordered and sentencing hearing set.  Court dismisses 12CF164 & Counts 3-6 of 14CF104.  gg
